name: Bacon and Egg
instructions: 1. Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy.
2. Remove bacon from skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, crack eggs and cook until desired doneness.
4. Season eggs with salt and pepper.
5. Serve bacon and eggs together.

name: Scrambled Egg with Sausage
instructions: 1. Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until browned.
2. In a bowl, beat eggs with salt and pepper.
3. Pour beaten eggs into the skillet with the sausage.
4. Cook and stir until eggs are set.
5. Serve scrambled eggs with sausage.

name: Pinakbet
instructions: 1. Cut vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a pot, sauté pork belly until browned.
3. Add shrimp paste and stir for a minute.
4. Add vegetables and stir until coated with shrimp paste.
5. Pour enough water to cover the vegetables.
6. Simmer until vegetables are tender.
7. Serve hot.

name: Sinabawang Isda
instructions: 1. Clean and prepare the fish.
2. In a pot, combine water, tomatoes, ginger, and onion.
3. Bring to a boil.
4. Add the fish and simmer until cooked.
5. Add green chili and water spinach.
6. Season with salt to taste.
7. Serve hot.

name: Pork BBQ
instructions: 1. Cut pork into skewer-sized pieces.
2. In a bowl, combine soy sauce, ketchup, brown sugar, minced garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
3. Marinate pork in the mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight.
4. Thread marinated pork onto skewers.
5. Grill over medium heat until cooked, brushing with marinade occasionally.
6. Serve hot.

name: Pork Sisig
instructions: 1. Boil pork belly until tender, then grill or broil until crispy.
2. Dice grilled pork into small pieces.
3. In a pan, sauté diced onion until translucent.
4. Add chopped green chili and red chili.
5. Add the diced pork and stir well.
6. Season with calamansi juice, salt, and pepper.
7. Stir in mayonnaise.
8. Serve hot.

name: Mango Grahams
instructions: 1. Peel and slice mangoes into thin pieces.
2. In a bowl, mix all-purpose cream and condensed milk.
3. Layer graham crackers, mango slices, and cream mixture in a dish.
4. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of cream mixture on top.
5. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before serving.
6. Serve cold.

name: Peach Mango Pie
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Peel and dice peaches and mangoes.
3. In a bowl, toss diced fruit with sugar and cinnamon.
4. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat and cook the fruit mixture until soft and caramelized.
5. Roll out puff pastry sheets and cut into squares.
6. Spoon the fruit mixture onto one half of each pastry square.
7. Fold the other half of the pastry over the filling to create a triangle.
8. Press the edges to seal and crimp with a fork.
9. Place pies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
11. Serve warm.
